definition[0]: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems
example[2]: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear (=someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems).
example[3]: I’m sympathetic to parents who are worried about what their children see on television.
definition[1]: willing to give approval and support to an aim or plan
example[4]: Senator Capp is very sympathetic to environmental issues.
definition[2]: providing the right conditions for someone
definition[3]: kind to someone who is having problems
example[6]: My friends were very sympathetic when I lost my job.
example[7]: Jill was a very sympathetic listener.
definition[4]: wanting to help people who are suffering or having problems
example[8]: The doctor was a compassionate man who always acted in his patients’ best interests.
definition[5]: not getting angry with someone or criticizing them, because you can see that they have problems
example[9]: I have had a lot of time off work, but my boss is very understanding.
definition[6]: caring about other people’s feelings and wanting to help them
example[12]: Most of the nurses are very caring.
